questions.questionText: What is software engineering?
options: The application of engineering principles to software development.

questions.questionText: Name one goal of software engineering.
options: To create software with minimal effort.
To eliminate the need for hardware.

questions.questionText: What is software quality assurance (SQA)?
options: A method to ensure software works as expected.

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of software testing?
options: To identify and fix defects in software.
To write new code for applications.

questions.questionText: Define the term 'bug' in software development.
options: An error or flaw in software.

questions.questionText: What does SDLC stand for?
Name one phase of the software development lifecycle (SDLC).
What is the primary responsibility of a software engineer?
What is the difference between functional and non-functional requirements?
options: Functional relates to appearance, non-functional relates to cost.
Functional defines what software should do, non-functional defines how it should behave.
Functional focuses on coding, non-functional on debugging.
Functional is for engineers, non-functional is for users.

questions.questionText: What is version control in software engineering?
options: A method to update computer hardware.
A system to track changes to code over time.
A tool to improve software performance.

questions.questionText: Explain the importance of requirement analysis in software engineering.
options: It helps identify user needs and system constraints.

questions.questionText: What is the difference between black-box and white-box testing?
options: Black-box tests the UI, white-box tests the backend.
Black-box tests internal code; white-box tests external interfaces.
Black-box focuses on inputs/outputs without code knowledge; white-box requires code knowledge.
Black-box is manual; white-box is automated.

questions.questionText: What is regression testing?
options: Ensuring recent changes haven’t broken existing features.
A test to measure application speed.

questions.questionText: What is test-driven development (TDD)?
options: A coding practice where tests are written before the code.
A testing method for hardware systems.
A debugging approach for existing code.

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of integration testing?
options: To test individual modules in isolation.
To test how different modules work together.

questions.questionText: What is a software design pattern?
options: A predefined solution to a common problem.
A template for user interface design.

questions.questionText: What is continuous deployment in software engineering?
options: Automatically deploying all changes to production after passing tests.
Deploying new features once a month.

questions.questionText: What is a microservices architecture?
options: A design approach where applications are built as a collection of small, independent services.
A method to debug monolithic applications.
A practice to optimize user interfaces.

questions.questionText: What is pair programming?
options: Two programmers work together, one writes code while the other reviews.
A method to duplicate code for debugging.

questions.questionText: What is the primary focus of DevOps?
options: Integrating development and operations teams to improve collaboration.
